definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: In the past a tribal native east of China really admired the rites of China.
sentences.chinese: 以前东方有个夷人，他很仰慕华夏文明的礼法。

sentences.english: It is the promoter of the main trend combining rites and law of Chinese tr…
sentences.chinese: 春秋决狱是中国传统法律文化礼法融合主潮的促动者。

sentences.english: The third part explore the relationship between ancestress temple and the clan manners.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分探讨女祠堂与宗族礼法之间的关系。

definition: three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
to overstep etiquette/not to observe priorities
